definition: to increase without letup/to get worse and worse (idiom)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to increase/to expand/to add
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish

sentences.english: Their desire for expansion has increased.
sentences.chinese: 他们的扩张欲望有增无减。

sentences.english: In the course of the argument, the most enormous errors of fact simply pullulated.
sentences.chinese: 在争论过程中，最厉害的事实谬误简直有增无减。

sentences.english: Friends come and go, but enemies accumulate.
sentences.chinese: 朋友有分有合，敌人则有增无减。

sentences.english: The number of burglaries in the area seems to be on the increase .
sentences.chinese: 这一地区入室盗窃案件似有增无减。

sentences.english: The resentment festered in his mind.
The growth in popularity of international dressage has been dynamic.
sentences.chinese: 国际盛装舞步的受欢迎程度一直以来有增无减。

definition: to increase steadily/to grow with each passing day
(of prices, rates etc) to remain high
to increase rapidly/to shoot up
dramatic increase
all the more/even more/further
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
to progress (or increase, change etc) day by day/more (or better etc) with each passing day
sharp increase/rapid growth
day by day/more and more/increasingly/more and more with each passing day
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
more and more
(increasing) day by day/(more critical) with every passing day/gradually
all the more/increasingly
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
steep decline
rapid/sudden
